DataElement.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Therapy Intervention or Procedure Fourth Course Treatment Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date of initiation of the fourth course of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Therapy Intervention or Procedure Fourth Course
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Initiation of the fourth course of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.:Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

Concepts.definition: Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
